events.message: Customer reported a car collision incident that occurred downtown on April 30th, providing initial accident details.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords found in the customer’s initial report.
Assigned agent Michael Turner was contacted to handle the vehicle collision claim and to guide the customer through the process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the car accident claim and outlining next steps.
Requested submission of police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and medical bills related to the collision injuries.
Customer uploaded the police report, vehicle repair invoices, and medical documentation showing treatment from the accident.
Internal investigation commenced to verify accident details, evaluate damages, and confirm liability with involved parties.
Completed investigation found no discrepancies in submitted evidence; liability confirmed and damages reasonably assessed.
Proposed claim settlement amount communicated to the customer, reflecting full coverage for vehicle repairs and medical expenses.
Customer responded positively to settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the responsiveness and resolution.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement and verification of documentation.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and remitted to the customer’s bank account for repair and medical cost coverage.
The claim was officially closed after confirming customer received payment and expressed final satisfaction with service.
All documentation and claim files were archived for record keeping and future reference in accordance with compliance policies.
